item.title: Report E-2025020410
item.description:
Report E-2025020410

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: HAZLETON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio Express
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, the drum was discovered to be leaking inside the trailer sitting on a skid. The drum was immediately turned up side down and placed into an overpack for containment. Investigation revealed that this drum was punctured by a protruding nail from the skid. The released material was neutralized and containerized for later disposal. The package specifications were not able to be safely obtained.

item.title: Report X-2025021295
item.description:
Report X-2025021295

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-15
  • City: BERWYN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found to be leaking. There is a strong odor of gasoline. DG admin was called and it was discussed the inner contents looked to be brown and in class bottles and there was a very strong odor on gasoline. The package was then held. The customer has called and insist they need their "water" the DG agent let them know that we do not think this is water and that we are turing this over to the FAA for investigation. From our experience we truely believe this is a sample of some sort that contains a high level of gasoline because of the look and the smell of the spill this is not water. Also if it was water you could have shipped it in plastic contianers.
